newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian industry to grow faster in Q4 96/97--Maran.
newsitem.headline: Indian industry to grow faster in Q4 96/97--Maran.

text.p: Indian Industry Minister Murasoli Maran said on Thursday the industry sector will post higher growth in the last quarter of 1996/97 (April-March).
"I think we can attain double-digit industrial growth and we are optimistic about growth in the last quarter. Let us wait and see," Maran told Reuters in an interview.
"The last quarter growth will be encouraging."
India expects industry to grow at 12 percent in the current financial year ending on March 31. The sector grew at 12 percent in 1995/96 against 9.4 percent the previous year.
The index of industrial production (IIP) increased by 9.8 percent during April-October 1996, compared with 11.7 percent in the same period the previous year.

Maran said the electricity industry was a major reason for the slowdown in industrial growth in the current fiscal year. The electricity industry grew at 3.4 percent in April-October compared with 10.1 percent in the previous year.
"The electricity sector is not doing well. Now the hydel dams are full so it may compensate," Maran said.
